Package src.game

Class DotsAndBoxesGame

java.lang.Object
src.game.DotsAndBoxesGame
public class DotsAndBoxesGame extends Object
Class that represents a Dots and boxes game

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    checkAddSquare()
    Checks if the number of squares has been changed after a move has been made If there is a change in the number of squares the score is increased for the player who made the move
    void
    doMove(DotsAndBoxesMove move)
    The method sets a line on the given index after a move is made and then changes the scores of the players if necessary
    Board
    getBoard()
    This method returns the board in its current state
    AbstractPlayer
    getCurrentPlayer()
    The method returns the player whose turn it is currently
    int
    getPlayer1Score()
    Method used to get the score of the first player
    int
    getPlayer2Score()
    Method used to get the score of the second player
    AbstractPlayer
    getTurn()
    Gives the current player of the game whose turn it is to play
    List<DotsAndBoxesMove>
    getValidMoves()
    The method returns a list of valid moves to choose from
    AbstractPlayer
    getWinner()
    Gives the player name with the highest score
    boolean
    isGameover()
    Uses the isGameOver method from the board field to check if the game is over
    boolean
    isValidMove(DotsAndBoxesMove move)
    This method checks if the move being made is valid by checking if the index is valid and there are no other lines in that index
    boolean
    scoreChanged()
    The method checks if there is a difference between the number of squares before and after a move has been made

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(DotsAndBoxesMove move)
      This method checks if the move being made is valid by checking if the index is valid and there are no other lines in that index
      Parameters:
      move - is the move being made
      Returns:
      true or false depending on move
